summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 7, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in continuous lockdown status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring observations at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by a lieutenant and captain.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets detailing 30-minute observation checks on inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York.
The checks were conducted on July 7, 2019, and follow a protocol requiring inmates in continuous lockdown to be observed at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets were reviewed by supervisory staff including a Morning Watch Lieutenant, a Captain, an Evening Watch Operations Lieutenant, and a Day Watch Operations Lieutenant.
The document does not name any specific inmates, only the staff conducting and reviewing the checks.
The procedural nature of the document indicates standard prison operations for monitoring high-security or segregated inmates.
